alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:20AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Otter Tail, northern Wilkin and northeastern Richland Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 220 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Galchutt, or 12 miles northwest of Wahpeton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... McCauleyville and Abercrombie around 225 AM CDT. Kent and Brushvale around 230 AM CDT. Lawndale around 250 AM CDT. Rothsay around 255 AM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 24 and 38. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 30 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
